title: Tune Style B homepage palette for cohesive light/dark appearance

requirements.summary: Refine Style B theme variables and banner gradient/opacity so PublicOverviewPage + MarketingBanner have a cohesive, readable palette in light and dark modes without affecting Style A.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user toggles to Style B on the public homepage, the overall color tone looks consistent across the page sections and the MarketingBanner (no obvious mismatched tints between background, card surfaces, and banner gradient).
In both light and dark mode with Style B enabled, text remains comfortably readable (no low-contrast combinations on background/card/accent surfaces).
Changes are limited to Style B behavior; Style A styling remains visually unchanged.

file_operations.description: Adjust only the Style B CSS variable overrides (the .home-style-b and .dark .home-style-b blocks) to refine background/card/accent/border/ring tone for a more balanced palette in light and dark modes; keep all base :root and .dark variables unchanged to avoid impacting Style A.

Update Style B-only banner presentation (variant === 'B') to better align with the refined Style B variables—e.g., tweak the gradient stops/opacity choices and any surface translucency values used by banner/card styling—while keeping variant A classes unchanged and avoiding edits to any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
